question:
Which along the following pairs of Pelagic Deposits is/are correctly matched?
  1. Neretic Matter - It consists of matter derived from algae and they are generally referred to as ooze.
  2. Pelagic Matter - Contain skeletons of marine organisms and plant remains.Â 
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation:
Pelagic Deposits are the organic and Inorganic sediments deposited on the ocean floor. They are derived from the skeletons of marine organisms and marine plant remains.
They can be categorized into :
Neretic Matter - Contain skeletons of marine organisms and plant remains.
Pelagic Matter - It consists of matter derived from algae and they are generally referred to as ooze.
